name: Would this "B" in the Bible? Online Trivia | Bible Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: In Numbers 22:41 of the KJV, Balak took Baalam to the high places of whom?
questions.explanation:
Baal.

	Baal was an idol of the Phoenicians. His name means "master or lord".

questions.text: David smote some people in the B-place mentioned in 2 Samuel 5:20 of the KJV; again in 1 Chronicles 14:11 it is mentioned as well. Where was it?
questions.explanation:
Baalperazim.

	David named the place Baalperazim because "the Lord hath broken forth upon mine enemies before me, as the breach of waters." Baalperazim was located in Israel west of Jerusalem.

questions.text: Lot did something starting with a B in Genesis 19:3 in the King James Version. He did it to unleavened bread. What did he do?
questions.explanation:
Bake.

	Unleavened bread is bread without yeast in it. It is the bread Jews use for Passover. Lot did his baking for two angels that met him in Sodom.

questions.text: In Job 39:12 of the KJV, some asked Job the following question: "Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed and gather it into the Barn?" Who asked him about this B-place?
questions.explanation:
God.

	Job had been through a lot and started to demand to speak to God wanting to know what he did to deserve what happened to him. In Job's eyes, he was an upstanding man. God finally spoke to Job asking him all these questions that reminded Job that God was in total control.

questions.text: Jesus could have been released on the day of his crucifixion. Who was released instead, however?
questions.explanation:
Barabbas.

	Barabbas was a murderer but the people hated Jesus so much they'd rather let him die and set a murderer free. This was tradition in Rome that once a year the people could pick one person to be set free and avoid them being crucified or killed in another manner.

questions.text: When is the first time "barrel" is used in the King James Version?
questions.explanation:
1 Kings 17:12.

	1 Kings 17:12 says, "And she said, As the LORD thy God liveth, I have not a cake, but an handful of meal in a barrel, and a little oil in a cruse: and, behold, I am gathering two sticks, that I may go in and dress it for me and my son, that we may eat it, and die." This is the woman who had Elijah go to her house. She was very poor but because she helped Elijah, God saw to it that she never went hungry.

questions.text: Isaiah prophesies in Isaiah 2:20 of the KJV "in that day a man shall cast his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which they make each one for himself to worship, to the moles and the ..." what?
questions.explanation:
Bats.

	Isaiah is talking about a time when people worship false idols. Many Christians believe an idol is anything that takes the place of God.

questions.text: Who was the king who saw the hand writing on the wall?
questions.explanation:
Belshazzar.

	He had thrown a banquet and suddenly saw a man's hand writing on the wall. Right after Daniel told him what it meant, Belshazzar died. The writing said, in 5:25 (KJV) "Mene, mene, tekel upharsin". If you read 26-28 you can find out the translation.

questions.text: This king warred against Samaria in 1 Kings 20:1 (KJV). Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Ben Hadad.

	Ben Hadad means "son of Hadad" or "noise". He had made a pact with Asa and they conquered a great part of North Israel.

questions.text: Who was the son of Baladan, King of Babylon?
questions.explanation:
Berodachbaldan.

	Berodachbaladen sent letters and priests to Hezekiah because he heard that Hezekiah was sick. Hezekiah was one of the kings in the Bible.
